revised_title: Pseudo-Stationary Flow Behind Strong Shocks: Diffraction and Reflection at Corners
tldr: This article discusses the pseudo-stationary flow behind strong shocks that occur when a shock wave encounters a corner. The authors transform the equations of unsteady compressible flow into those of a steady flow with non-conservative external forces and a field of sinks. They analyze the flow patterns and characteristics, including the possibility of Prandtl-Meyer flow and sonic curves, in both subsonic and supersonic cases.
